description: Black Orcs are brutal brawlers but they are sluggish. They screen with high strength and toughness to pummel their opposition into submission while their battle hardened Goblins use every dirty trick in their repertoire as they trudge down the pitch.

Chaos Chosen are brutal thugs. Their high Strength scores and access to Mutation skills makes them better at dealing damage than almost any other team. However, starting Chaos Chosen are sorely lacking in skills, and they take time to develop.

Chaos Renegades are one of the most versatile teams: they can have an Ogre, a Troll, a Minotaur, a Dark Elf, a Skaven, and a Goblin, all of whom add "spice" to their strong core of Marauders, which can be developed in myriad ways.
Dark Elves are the slowest, brawniest, and most aggressive of all the elf teams. Like all elves, they lack access to Strength skills, but they are one of the best teams for positioning and control.

Dwarfs are the slowest team of all, but nobody can match the Dwarfs for pure tenacity, toughness, and skill. Aggressive Slayers and doughty Blockers provide support for their talented Runners and versatile Blitzers.

Elven Union are poorly-armoured and only moderately fast, but have excellent skill players. Their Catchers are especially good at dealing with coverage, and their Blitzers control the sideline quite well, while their linemen are cheaper than other elves.

Goblins are not a good team for a beginning coach. In fact, they are not a "good" team at all. They make up for their deficiencies by sneaking Secret Weapons onto the field to wreak havoc on the enemy's game plan!

Halflings are small and squishy, but good at moving around between the legs of their opponents. Their friends, the Treemen, are strong and woody. Between the two, they make a fun team for advanced coaches to play.
Humans are one of the most versatile teams. They lack great agility or strength, but make up for it with skillful, hard-hitting Blitzers, good speed, and cheap players.
Imperial Nobility are fronted by flashy Blitzers and steadfast Blockers. Their Linemen are poorly armoured though do their plucky best to Fend off the opposition and rerolls are expensive.

Lizardmen are a team of extremes. Their Saurus and Kroxigor players are exceptionally strong and tough, and not too slow, but are not good at handling the ball. Their Skinks are small and fragile, but very fast and reasonably nimble.

Necromantic teams are one of the three "undead" teams. Werewolves are fast and deadly, among the best players of all. Flesh Golems are strong at the point of attack. Wights add a mean streak, Ghouls handle the ball, and Zombies fill in the gaps.

Nurgle is a Power of Chaos, the Father of Decay. Nurgle Warriors and Beasts of Nurgle are strong, tough, slow, and hideous. The mobile, aggressive Pestigors handle the ball and do the blitzing, while decaying Rotters fill out the roster on the cheap.

Ogres are mighty creatures, but none too bright. Wherever they go, a mob of tiny, vicious Snotlings follows, running about underfoot and getting in the enemy team's way. Ogres are a difficult team to master, but they're lots of fun!
Old World Alliance are rag-tag teams of humans, dwarves and halflings. A great combination as long as they manage to cooperate.

Orcs are the classic heavy-duty bash team. Excellent strength and toughness help to make up for a general lack of speed. Orc Blitzers and Blockers are very physical players, and sure-handed Throwers are good for picking up the ball.

Undead are noted for their variety of positions. Their basic player, the Zombie, is a cheap, tough speed bump. Ghouls provide coverage and ball handling, while Wights and Mummies give the team solid firepower.

Skaven are the fastest team race of all. Their players are all quick, and most are fairly cheap. Gutter Runners are the fastest players of all! Though Skaven have poor armour, they also have limited access to Mutation skills.
Snotlings are a hopeless team requiring luck, mayhem and chaos to get anything done, let alone winning. Good luck!

Underworld are an uneasy alliance of goblins and skaven. The Goblins and Warpstone Troll clog up the field and provide cover for the rat-men, who zip about and win the game. The team gets Mutation skills, which works strongly to their advantage.

Wood Elves are probably the most acrobatic teams, with Linemen as fast as Skaven and nimble like the elves they are. They feature possibly the best player position in the game, the leaping, dodging, blitzing Wardancer!

Amazons don't have speed or strength or agility or armour. They make up for a lack of athleticism and star power with an excellent base of starting skills, making them a good control team, very hard to knock down.

Chaos Dwarfs are a classic grind team. Tough, speedy, strong Bull Centaurs are the best players on the team, while the Chaos Dwarfs themselves are hard-hitting blockers and the expendable Hobgoblin slaves provide versatility.

High Elves are one of the most mobile of all teams, with reasonably good armour as well. High Elf Throwers are experts at throwing accurate passes into traffic, and their Catchers and Blitzers are fast-moving and nimble.

Norse teams are aggressive, strong, and spirited. Eschewing armour for pure ferocity, a Norse squad is something of a glass hammer. Ferocious Snow Trolls, Ulfwerener, and Berserkers provide oomph alongside their skillful but fragile core players.

Khemri, one of the three "undead" teams, are the single strongest team of all, with up to four mighty Tomb Guardians. However, they are also the clumsiest team, and rely on cheap players to make up for generally poor mobility and armour.

Vampires are powerful, nimble, and blessed with a special hypnotizing power. However, they are hungry creatures and sometimes attack the Thralls that support them! It's a good thing the Thralls are cheap and versatile.

Khorne is the chaos god of blood and skulls. They're an uncontrollable, frenzied and chaotic mix of Khorne Warriors, Bloodspawn and Marauders. With Khorngors bringing some much needed reliability to the teams Blitzing.

Gnome Teams are small and squishy and unlike all other stunty teams they aren't even proficient at dodging away from trouble. But with a little help from two Treemen and some forest friends the Gnomes are able to hold their own.... on the odd occasion.
